results.title: Santa Claus: the movie
results.creator_credit: Alexander Salkind Productions, Alexander Salkind, Ilya Salkind and Jeannot Szwarc
results.brief_description: A live action film about Santa Claus, his elves and how one nasty rich man attempts to stop Christmas. The elves leave the Arctic to join Santa’s fight to bring back Christmas to all the children of the world. With Dudley Moore and John Lithgow.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alexander Salkind Productions, Alexander Salkind, Ilya Salkind and Jeannot Szwarc

results.title: Sanjuro = Tsubaki Sanjuro [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: This samurai film, in which a shabby warrior helps young clan members root out corruption among the elders of their clan is a kind of sequel to “Yojimbo” with excellent fighting sequences and effective moments of humour. Toshiro Mifune reprises his role as the ‘man with no name’ from the earlier film. He is a shambling, scratching, bedraggled character described by many critics and a cross between Robin Hood and John Wayne, with a touch of Humphrey Bogart thrown in. With a heady blend of traditional Japanese theatrical conventions and the language of Western film-making this is a masterpiece of comedy-drama. Cast also includes Masao Shimizu and Tatsuya Nakadai. Also available on VHS [301895].

results.title: San Francisco
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, John Emerson, Bernard H. Hyman and W S. Van Dyke
results.brief_description: A lavish production set in San Francisco, in which Clark Gable plays the role of Blackie Norton, proprietor of a riotous saloon. When Jeanette MacDonald arrives on the scene in search of a singing career, they fall in love. The climax takes place amongst the recreation of the great earthquake that hit the city in 1906. Cast also includes Spencer Tracy, Jack Holt, Jessie Ralph and Ted Healy. Screenplay by Anita Loos from the story by Robert Hopkins. Edited by Tom Neld.

results.title: Sample people
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Living Motion Pictures, Emile Sherman, Barton Smith and Clinton Smith
results.brief_description: Phil’s falafel shop is where it all goes down - some peoples’ lives culminate in a single defining moment and how they all get to that point over a forty-eight hour period is the storyline. Set in 1990s Sydney, the drug and techno music lifestyle of a group of young men and women is explored. DJ Lush Puppy (Nathalie Roy), the good-looking girl DJ and skateboard rider, is friend of Jess (Kylie Minogue) who is working in the sleazy underworld crime scene. Jess and her beau (Simon Lyndon) aim to make off with some cash, leaving the gangster lifestyle behind. Homeboy Joey and his mate Gus have a gun and not much to occupy their time except to be wild and crazy out on the streets. Sam (Joel Edgerton) has a premonition that his girlfriend is going to overdose and wants to get out of town on a holiday. Nightclubbing, sex and hallucinogenic trips send the friends into a spin and pursuit by the upset gangsters sets up some tension - all leading them to Phil’s Falafels where an armed robbery and death occur. Some lighter moments and one-liners aim to relieve the tense atmosphere, as does the rock/techno soundtrack. Cast includes: Ben Mendelsohn, David Field, Paula Arundell, Justin Rosniak, Matthew Wilkinson, Gandhi MacIntyre, Dorian Nkono.

results.title: Sally of the sawdust
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: Based on a stage play “Sally of the Sawdust” features the first screen appearance of W.C. Fields and is a silent romantic comedy directed by the great D.W. Griffith. The drama starts in a circus during the Twenties and introduces the story of an orphan Sally (Carol Dempster) and her loveable, juggler, circus performing carer Prof. Eustace P. McGarcle (Fields). Sally is initially unaware that McGargle is not her real father who, through the course of events, decides to reunite her with her grandparents. They make a comedic journey to the town of her grandparents where a wealthy man falls for the circus girl and the drama unfolds. It is a story of mistaken identity, romance and family reunions. The film is known more for being W.C. Fields first screen appearance than one of D.W. Griffith’s greats although it has all the hallmarks of his film genius. It is an entertaining and visually exciting silent melodrama. This version has a music score added. Cast includes Alfred Lunt a theatre actor making a rare screen appearance.

results.title: Sabrina = Sabrina fair
results.brief_description: Linus and David Larrabee are the two sons of a very wealthy Long Island family. Linus is all work, while David is all playboy. Meanwhile, Sabrina Fairchild is the young, shy, awkward daughter of the family’s chaffeur, who has been infatuated with David all her life. After a two year absence in Paris, Sabrina returns an elegant, sophisticated and beautiful woman. Suddenly, she finds that she has finally captured David’s attention, but as she does so, she finds herself falling in love with Linus, and he with her. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Audrey Hepburn, William Holden and Walter Hampden.

results.title: Sabotage = A Woman alone
results.creator_credit: Gaumont, Sir Michael Balcon, Ivor Montagu and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: The lights fail in a local cinema and the angry audience harass the young woman in the ticket box. Her husband, the cinema manager, will soon become the focus of an investigation into political sabotage on a grand scale - a plan to rob the entire city of electricity. This early Hitchcock classic, based on Joseph Conrad’s “The secret agent”, stars Sylvia Sydney, Oscar Homolka and Jon Loder. The video also includes outtakes from Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, the shower scene, which Hitchcock explains.

results.title: Ryan's daughter
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Anthony Havelock-Allan and David Lean
results.brief_description: Robert Mitchum is the rural school master Charles Shaughnessy who, returning home to Ireland in 1916, just after the Easter Rising against the British, falls in love with and marries one of his old pupils, Rosy Ryan. Their happiness is upset by the arrival of a Major who comes to take command of the British Army and is immediately drawn towards Rosy. Political events finally overtake all affairs of the heart, and it is obvious that life in the village of Kirrary will never be the same again. Scripted by Robert Bolt the film also stars Sarah Miles, John Mills, Trevor Howard and Leo McKern.

results.title: Ruthless people
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Silver Screen Partners II, Wagner Productions, Michael Peyser, Jim Abrahams, David Zucker and Jerry Zucker
results.brief_description: A black comedy tale of two kindly kidnappers, Ken and Sandy Kessler, exacting revenge on the rip-off merchant Sam (Danny DeVito) by taking his spoilt rich wife, Barbara (Bette Midler) as hostage. However when the Kesslers try to claim their ransom, the obnoxious and spiteful Sam, who is delighted at the opportunity to be rid of the wife he hates so much, refuses to pay. Barbara joins forces with the Kesslers and together they plan their revenge. Cast includes Judge Reinhold, Helen Slater, Anita Morris and Bill Pullman in his debut performance.
